page.title: 05Smallwood Lodge Newport
page.content: {Smallwood Lodge}is,a Tudor house in the High street. It is a timber building with a large stable surrounded by a{Victorian ironwork fence. Previously it was privately owned by Brooke Hecter Smallwood and the building is named after him. Today it is a thriving bookshop selling mainly childrens paperbacks. It has been rumoured that{supernatural {happenings}take place. The story goes that when the Lodge was a hotel a man came in for lodgings and died on the stool.Today he haunts the place sitting on the same stool. The present owner finds books scattered on the floor every morning and evening. The Lodge has an unusual feature in the{Victorian}window which looks blue on the outside and yellow on the inside.{
